aws::graph::propositions: # Dublin Texas Gyroplane Accident Information
The accident occurred in Dublin, Texas.
The accident occurred on October 5, 2019.
The accident occurred at 10:00 Local time.
The aircraft involved was a Pavel Vagner TANGO.
The defining event was loss of control in flight.
The flight was conducted under Part 91: General aviation - Personal.
The accident number was GAA20CA005.
The aircraft registration was N8445P.
The aircraft sustained substantial damage.
There was 1 person with no injuries.
The pilot reported the gyroplane was too high above the runway during landing.
The pilot attempted to cushion the landing by forcing the nose up.
The pilot gunned the engine a couple of times.
The fluctuations in torque caused the gyroplane to turn right.
The pilot corrected with hard, left rudder application.
The gyroplane was configured with the front wheel mechanically linked to the rudder for directional control.
The front wheel was turned completely left.
The gyroplane turned violently left upon touching down hard.
The gyroplane rolled onto its right side.
The gyroplane sustained substantial damage to the main rotor drive system.
The gyroplane sustained substantial damage to the empennage.
The pilot reported there were no preaccident mechanical failures with the gyroplane.
The pilot reported there were no preaccident mechanical malfunctions with the gyroplane.
The pilot reported the accident was caused by pilot error.
The National Transportation Safety Board determined the probable cause of the accident to be the pilot's improper landing flare.
The National Transportation Safety Board determined the probable cause of the accident to be the pilot's failure to maintain lateral control.
The improper landing flare resulted in a hard landing.
The improper landing flare resulted in loss of directional control.
The improper landing flare resulted in subsequent roll-over.

text:
# Aviation Investigation Final Report

## Location:
Dublin, Texas

## Date & Time: 
October 5, 2019, 10:00 Local

## Aircraft:
Pavel Vagner TANGO

## Defining Event:
Loss of control in flight

## Flight Conducted Under:
Part 91: General aviation - Personal

## Accident Number:
GAA20CA005

## Registration:
N8445P

## Aircraft Damage:
Substantial

## Injuries:
1 None

## Analysis

The pilot reported that, during landing, the gyroplane was too high above the runway. He attempted to "cushion the landing" by forcing the nose up as he "gunned the engine a couple of times." The fluctuations in torque caused the gyroplane to turn right, and he corrected with hard, left rudder application. Because the gyroplane was configured with the front wheel mechanically linked to the rudder for directional control, the front wheel was turned completely left, which resulted in the gyroplane turning "violently" left upon touching down hard and then rolling onto its right side. The gyroplane sustained substantial damage to the main rotor drive system and the empennage. The pilot reported that there were no preaccident mechanical failures or malfunctions with the gyroplane that would have precluded normal operation and that the accident was caused by pilot error.

## Probable Cause and Findings

The National Transportation Safety Board determines the probable cause(s) of this accident to be:

The pilot's improper landing flare and failure to maintain lateral control, which resulted in a hard landing, loss of directional control, and subsequent roll-over.

---
